snippet: The search giant also reported first-quarter revenue that rose 24 percent and earnings that slightly beat analysts’ expectations.
abstract: Google announces a two-for-one stock split alongside its quarterly results; split, a first since the company went public, will create a new class of nonvoting shares and allow the company to reward its employees without diluting existing shareholders; net income rose 60 percent, to $2.89 billion, or $8.88 a share, compared with $1.8 billion, or $5.59 a share, in the same quarter a year earlier; revenue rose 24 percent, to $10.65 billion.
lead_paragraph: The search giant also reported first-quarter revenue that rose 24 percent and earnings that slightly beat analysts’ expectations.

headline.seo: Google Announces a Two-for-One Stock Split
headline.print_headline: Google Says It Will Split Shares 2 for 1
